availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Wallace (Lawrence County, trader and soldier)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, trader and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Mary Wallace. Father of Elenor R. Wallace, Elizabeth C. Wallace, Pamela A. B. Wallace, Frederick R. W. Wallace, Charity A. Wallace, Francis T. Wallace, Eugene Wallace, Elden Wallace, and Grace Wallace. Merchant in Lawrence County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Lawrence County in 1850. Trader in Lawrence County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Lawrence County in 1860. Served in the 68th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as quarter-master from May 21, 1864 to June 22, 1864.
